ygData.subject: Re: Re: Icy Greaves
ygData.msgSnippet: It took me about 7 hours to get the fire boots from SolA.  I used my wizard (level 42) and had a level 50 wizard helping clear as many solusek goblins as we
ygData.messageBody:
It took me about 7 hours to get the fire boots from SolA. I
used my wizard (level 42) and had a level 50 wizard helping clear
as many solusek goblins as we could. For 5 hours there was also
another group in the king room clearing that and several
other nearby gobs, that were helping me look for boots.

Unlucky I guess, almost all the other items were under 30 minutes,
I still need both items for the helmet.

Ludvaraman (aka Ludde)
Level 27 bard
E'ci


>
> From: Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...>
>
> I have seen a couple of comments on how hard Icy Greaves are to get.
> This example matches my own experience, that they were easy.
>
> I went to king room twice. Once there was a group there i asked about
> looting icy greaves, they said they needed 4 pair (no bards in group...
> go figure). That night I returned and got in a group camping king room,
> they had cleared the room, next round (2nd or 3rd elite) I got greaves.
>
> If you decide to go to the room invis, beware, the Goblin Wizard can see
> invis.
>
> Uldar Ulfangson
> 32nd Bard, Rodcet Nife
>
> > So far the longest I've specifically camped an item was the icy greaves.
> > That took 2 and a half hours. So far my cleric has spent at least 4 hours
> > on each of the items required for his armor. I don't envy the clerics for
> > this quest, that's for sure.
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@... with the subject submissions.
>
